ground_truth: Harry slips inside Umbridge's office, where the walls are hung with China plates showing pictures of cats, and raises his wand. Umbridge's chair is upholstered in pink, and Harry notices two passive pink shoes placed neatly on the floor. He crosses to the desk, where there's a silver teapot and a China cup and saucer on lace doilies, and searches drawers. He finds files with photos attached, one of Mad-Eye Moody with a red cross through the photo and another of Professor Dumbledore crossed through in red. The Supervisor turns, and Harry emerges from Umbridge's office grim-faced, turns, and walks away, sopping wet. Harry and Ron leave the lift at courtroom level, where a man is hauled away by two guards. Harry tugs Ron's lapel, and they walk towards the courtroom where, from a high bench, Umbridge addresses a woman sitting below while wearing the locket around her neck. Mary sees Ron, and Harry pushes Ron forward into the courtroom, staying back himself, while Yaxley sits watching the proceedings. Ron stands beside Mary, Harry nods, and she holds it up as Dementors hover above. Harry's eyes are fixed on Umbridge as he spots the locket around her neck, and his wand drops into his hand. Umbridge sees it, Hermione trembles, and his face distorts as Ron zaps Yaxley. Hermione grabs the locket from Umbridge and tosses it to Harry, now back to himself, as Yaxley sees them race off. The hovering Dementors chase the group into the lift, but they're stopped by the closing gate as their arms and long-boned fingers reach through the metal grill, attempting to suck the souls out of the four in the lift. Harry raises his wand, forcing the Dementors back with a spell, and the lift zooms upwards. The atrium is busy, with people upon walkways and at ground level, as a lift arrives and the group looks around before stepping out into it. Hermione and Harry are both back to themselves, but Ron still looks like Reginald, and Mary clings to him, taking his face in her hands and kissing him on the lips. During the kiss, Ron shrinks and transforms back to himself, and Mary steps back as the real Reginald appears in his vest and boxers, seeing Ron, who turns. Uniformed guards chase Harry as Yaxley arrives in the lift, and Hermione and Ron race after Harry. Yaxley barges past people, hurling bursts of energy at the trio, narrowly missing them as Harry spins his wand at a pile of posters, causing the reward posters for Harry Undesirable Number One to swirl around the atrium, almost engulfing Yaxley, who brushes them aside. The trio reaches the corridor as Yaxley aims another burst, but the spell disarms Yaxley. Ron grimaces as he runs, glances back, and sees Yaxley gaining on him.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Harry sneaks within Umbridge's chamber, where the partitions are adorned with China dishes displaying images of felines, and lifts his rod. Umbridge's seat is cushioned in pink, and Harry observes two inactive pink footwear positioned tidily on the ground. He traverses to the bureau, where there's a silver kettle and a China mug and plate on lace coasters, and examines drawers. He discovers folders with pictures affixed, one of Mad-Eye Moody with a scarlet mark through the snapshot and another of Professor Dumbledore marked through in red. The Supervisor rotates, and Harry exits Umbridge's chamber somber-faced, turns, and strides away, drenched wet. Harry and Ron depart the elevator at tribunal level, where a man is dragged away by two security. Harry pulls Ron's collar, and they proceed towards the tribunal where, from a lofty seat, Umbridge addresses a lady seated beneath while wearing the trinket around her neck. Mary witnesses Ron, and Harry nudges Ron forward into the tribunal, remaining back himself, while Yaxley sits observing the process. Ron stands beside Mary, Harry nods, and she holds it up as Dementors linger above. Harry's eyes are fixed on Umbridge as he notices the trinket around her neck, and his rod falls into his grasp. Umbridge perceives it, Hermione quivers, and his visage contorts as Ron zaps Yaxley. Hermione snatches the trinket from Umbridge and flings it to Harry, now reverted to himself, as Yaxley sees them dart away. The lingering Dementors pursue the group into the elevator, but they're halted by the shutting gate as their limbs and elongated fingers extend through the metal lattice, attempting to drain the spirits out of the four in the elevator. Harry lifts his rod, compelling the Dementors back with a charm, and the elevator speeds upward. The atrium is bustling, with individuals upon walkways and at ground level, as an elevator arrives and the group glances around before stepping out into it. Hermione and Harry are both reverted to themselves, but Ron still resembles Reginald, and Mary grasps him, taking his visage in her palms and kissing him on the mouth. During the kiss, Ron diminishes and changes back to himself, and Mary steps back as the true Reginald appears in his undershirt and shorts, seeing Ron, who turns. Uniformed security pursue Harry as Yaxley arrives in the elevator, and Hermione and Ron chase after Harry. Yaxley forces past individuals, launching bursts of energy at the trio, barely missing them as Harry twirls his rod at a heap of notices, causing the bounty notices for Harry Undesirable Number One to whirl around the atrium, nearly swallowing Yaxley, who brushes them aside. The trio reaches the passageway as Yaxley directs another burst, but the charm disarms Yaxley. Ron winces as he sprints, glances back, and sees Yaxley advancing on him.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Harry slips inside Umbridge's office, where the walls are hung with China plates showing pictures of cats, and his wand is raised by him. Pink upholsters Umbridge's chair, and Harry notices two passive pink shoes placed neatly on the floor. The desk is crossed to by him, where a silver teapot and a China cup and saucer are on lace doilies, and the drawers are searched. Files with photos are found by him, one of Mad-Eye Moody with a red cross through the photo and another of Professor Dumbledore crossed through in red. Harry turns when the Supervisor emerges from Umbridge's office grim-faced, turns, and he walks away, sopping wet. The lift is left by Harry and Ron at courtroom level, where two guards haul away a man. Ron's lapel is tugged by Harry, and they walk towards the courtroom where, from a high bench, Umbridge addresses a woman sitting below while wearing the locket around her neck. Ron is seen by Mary, and Ron is pushed forward by Harry into the courtroom, staying back himself, while Yaxley watches the proceedings. Mary is stood beside by Ron, Harry nods, and it is held up by her as Dementors hover above. Umbridge is fixed upon by Harry's eyes as the locket around her neck is spotted, and his wand drops into his hand. It is seen by Umbridge, Hermione trembles, and as Ron zaps Yaxley, his face distorts. The locket is grabbed by Hermione from Umbridge and tossed to Harry, now back to himself, as Yaxley sees them race off. The group is chased into the lift by the hovering Dementors, but the closing gate stops them as their arms and long-boned fingers reach through the metal grill, attempting to suck the souls out of the four in the lift. His wand is raised by Harry, forcing the Dementors back with a spell, and the lift zooms upwards. The atrium is busy, with people upon walkways and at ground level, as a lift arrives and the group looks around before stepping out into it. Hermione and Harry are both back to themselves, but Reginald is still looked like by Ron, and he is clung to by Mary, taking his face in her hands and kissing him on the lips. Ron shrinks and transforms back to himself during the kiss, and Mary steps back as the real Reginald appears in his vest and boxers, seeing Ron, who turns. Harry is chased by uniformed guards as Yaxley arrives in the lift, and Harry is raced after by Hermione and Ron. People are barged past by Yaxley, who hurls bursts of energy at the trio, narrowly missing them as a pile of posters is spun at by Harry's wand, causing the reward posters for Harry Undesirable Number One to swirl around the atrium, almost engulfing Yaxley, who brushes them aside. The corridor is reached by the trio as Yaxley aims another burst, but the spell disarms Yaxley. A grimace is made by Ron as he runs, glances back, and sees Yaxley gaining on him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry sneaks into Umbridge's office, where China plates with cat images line the walls, and lifts his wand. Umbridge's chair is pink, and two passive pink shoes sit neatly on the floor. At the desk, Harry finds a silver teapot and a China cup on lace doilies and searches drawers. He discovers files with photos, including one of Mad-Eye Moody and another of Professor Dumbledore, both crossed in red. Harry emerges from the office, grim-faced and wet. He and Ron exit the lift at courtroom level, where guards escort a man away. Harry pulls Ron toward the courtroom, where Umbridge speaks to a woman while wearing a locket. Mary notices Ron, and Harry pushes him forward, staying back as Yaxley observes. Ron joins Mary as Dementors hover above. Harry sees Umbridge's locket and readies his wand. Umbridge reacts, Hermione trembles, and Ron zaps Yaxley. Hermione grabs the locket, tossing it to Harry, who reverts to himself. Yaxley watches them flee. Dementors pursue them into the lift, but the closing gate stops them. Harry casts a spell, repelling the Dementors, and the lift ascends. In the busy atrium, they step out. Hermione and Harry are normal, but Ron still appears as Reginald; Mary kisses him, transforming him back. The real Reginald appears, and Ron turns. Guards chase Harry as Yaxley arrives, and Hermione and Ron follow. Yaxley shoots energy bursts, narrowly missing them as Harry spins his wand, sending Undesirable Number One posters swirling around Yaxley. The trio reaches a corridor, and Yaxley fires again, but the spell disarms him. Ron grimaces, seeing Yaxley gaining.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry enters Umbridge's office, filled with cat-adorned china plates, pink upholstery, and neatly placed shoes. He searches her desk, finding files with red-crossed photos of Mad-Eye Moody and Dumbledore. Grim-faced, Harry exits sopping wet. Harry and Ron walk to the courtroom where Umbridge addresses a woman while wearing a locket. Mary sees Ron, and Harry pushes him forward. As Dementors hover, Harry spots the locket and his wand appears. Ron zaps Yaxley, Hermione grabs the locket and tosses it to Harry. They escape into a lift, forcing back Dementors with a spell. In the atrium, Hermione and Harry revert to themselves; Ron transforms back after a kiss from Mary. Guards chase Harry, Hermione, and Ron as Yaxley attacks, but Harry's spell nearly engulfs Yaxley in posters. The trio reaches a corridor, and Yaxley’s spell is disarmed. Ron glances back as Yaxley closes in.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Harry stealthily slips inside the dimly lit office belonging to Umbridge, where the walls are laden with an eclectic display of decorative China plates, each showcasing endearing pictures of cats. He cautiously raises his wand, ready for any eventuality. The distinctive chair belonging to Umbridge is upholstered in a garish pink fabric, and Harry takes note of two passive pink shoes that are meticulously positioned on the floor with precision. He moves deliberately towards the imposing desk, where a gleaming silver teapot and a delicate China cup and saucer rest atop intricate lace doilies, and begins to rummage through the drawers carefully. During his search, he uncovers files that have photographs attached, notably one of Mad-Eye Moody, which has an ominous red cross slashed through the image, and another photograph of Professor Dumbledore, similarly crossed through in bold red ink. Just as the Supervisor turns, Harry emerges from Umbridge's office wearing a grim expression, then proceeds to turn and walk away, completely sopping wet. 

Harry, accompanied by Ron, exits the lift at the level of the courtroom, where they witness a man being forcefully hauled away by two imposing guards. With a quick tug at Ron's lapel, Harry guides them both toward the direction of the courtroom. From a high and authoritative bench, Umbridge addresses a woman seated below her, notably adorned with a locket prominently displayed around her neck. Mary glances towards Ron, at which point Harry gives Ron a push forward into the courtroom while he holds back, remaining outside the proceedings. Yaxley is seated, keenly watching the ongoing proceedings unfold. As Ron takes his place beside Mary, Harry offers a nod, prompting her to hold it up as ominous Dementors remain hovering above menacingly. Harry's eyes are fixated on Umbridge, particularly drawn to the locket around her neck, prompting his wand to drop reflexively into his hand. Umbridge catches sight of it, and Hermione trembles with anticipation. Harry's face contorts with determination while Ron swiftly zaps Yaxley. Hermione, acting quickly, snatches the locket from Umbridge's possession and tosses it efficiently to Harry, who is now returned to his true form, as Yaxley observes them race off. The hovering Dementors launch a chase after the group as they make a dash to the lift, yet they are halted by the quickly closing gate as their skeletal arms and elongated fingers reach through the metal grill, desperately attempting to extract the souls of the four individuals trapped in the lift. Harry, displaying quick thinking, raises his wand decisively, casting a spell that forces the Dementors to retreat, and the lift subsequently zooms upwards.

In the bustling atrium, teeming with people both along walkways and at ground level, a lift arrives and the group takes a moment to look around before stepping out cautiously. Hermione and Harry have both reverted to their true selves, but Ron still maintains the appearance of Reginald. Mary remains clinging tightly to him, cupping his face tenderly in her hands and pressing a kiss onto his lips. During this affectionate exchange, Ron undergoes a transformation, shrinking and returning to his original self, prompting Mary to step back in surprise. Meanwhile, the real Reginald materializes in his vest and boxers, catching sight of Ron, who turns on his heel. Uniformed guards begin to chase Harry with urgency as Yaxley arrives with determination in the lift. Simultaneously, Hermione and Ron hasten to follow Harry. Yaxley, intent on catching them, forcefully barges past people, hurling potent bursts of energy towards the trio, narrowly missing them each time. In a quick reaction, Harry spins his wand skillfully at a pile of posters, causing the reward posters featuring Harry as Undesirable Number One to whirl around the crowded atrium, nearly engulfing Yaxley, who brushes them off vigorously. The trio makes their way towards the corridor as Yaxley prepares to aim another burst, but this time, the spell effectively disarms Yaxley. Ron grimaces while he continues to run, casting a glance back to see Yaxley steadily gaining ground on him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Harry, with calculated stealth, silently slips into the dimly lit office belonging to Umbridge. The walls are laden with a diverse and eclectic display of decorative China plates, each one charmingly showcasing endearing pictures of various cats. With caution, he raises his wand, ready and prepared for any potential eventuality. The distinctive chair that belongs to Umbridge is upholstered in a garish shade of pink fabric, and Harry notes the presence of two passive pink shoes meticulously positioned with precision on the floor. Moving deliberately towards the imposing desk, he notices a gleaming silver teapot and a delicate China cup and saucer resting atop intricate lace doilies, from where he begins to rummage carefully through the drawers. During this careful search, he uncovers files attached with photographs, notably one of Mad-Eye Moody, which has an ominous red cross slashed through his image, and another photograph of Professor Dumbledore, similarly crossed through with bold red ink. Just as the Supervisor turns, Harry emerges from Umbridge's office, wearing a grim expression, and proceeds to turn and walk away, completely sopping wet.

Alongside Ron, Harry exits the lift upon reaching the level where the courtroom is situated, and there they witness a man being forcefully hauled away by two imposing and burly guards. With a quick tug at Ron's lapel, Harry guides them both in the direction leading to the courtroom. From a high and authoritative bench, Umbridge addresses a woman seated below, who is notably adorned with a locket prominently displayed around her neck. Mary glances toward Ron, at which point Harry gives Ron a gentle but firm push forward into the courtroom while he remains outside the proceedings, holding back. Meanwhile, Yaxley is seated, keenly and intently watching the ongoing proceedings as they unfold. As Ron takes his place beside Mary, Harry offers a nod, prompting Mary to hold the locket up as ominous Dementors hover menacingly above. Harry's eyes fixate on Umbridge, particularly drawn to the locket hanging around her neck, causing his wand to drop reflexively into his hand. Umbridge catches sight of this, and Hermione trembles with anticipation. Harry's face contorts with determination, and Ron swiftly zaps Yaxley. Acting quickly, Hermione snatches the locket from Umbridge's possession and efficiently tosses it to Harry, who has now returned to his true form. Yaxley observes them as they race off, prompting the hovering Dementors to launch a chase after the group. They dash towards the lift but are halted by the quickly closing gate as skeletal arms and elongated fingers reach through the metal grill, desperately attempting to extract the souls of the four individuals trapped inside the lift. Harry, displaying quick thinking, decisively raises his wand and casts a powerful spell that forces the Dementors to reluctantly retreat, allowing the lift to zoom upwards.

In the bustling atrium, teeming with people both along the walkways and at ground level, a lift arrives, and the group takes a moment to cautiously look around before stepping out. Hermione and Harry have both reverted to their true selves, yet Ron continues to maintain the appearance of Reginald. Mary clings tightly to him, tenderly cupping his face in her hands and pressing a kiss onto his lips. During this affectionate exchange, Ron undergoes a transformation, shrinking and returning to his original self, prompting Mary to step back in surprise. Meanwhile, the real Reginald materializes in his vest and boxers, catching sight of Ron, who promptly turns on his heel. Uniformed guards begin to pursue Harry with urgency as Yaxley arrives in the lift with determination. Simultaneously, Hermione and Ron hasten to follow Harry. Yaxley, intent on catching the trio, forcefully barges past people, hurling potent bursts of magical energy towards them, narrowly missing each time. In a quick reaction, Harry skillfully spins his wand at a pile of posters, causing the reward posters featuring him as Undesirable Number One to whirl around the crowded atrium, nearly engulfing Yaxley, who vigorously brushes them off. The trio makes their way towards a corridor as Yaxley prepares to aim another burst at them, but this time, the spell effectively disarms Yaxley. As Ron continues to run, he grimaces and casts a glance back to see Yaxley steadily gaining ground on him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry, moving with quiet determination, slips inside Umbridge's office, a room adorned with walls covered in China plates displaying images of cats, creating an almost whimsical yet unsettling atmosphere. He carefully raises his wand, scanning the space intently. The chair, upholstered in a distinct shade of pink, catches his eye, along with a pair of passive pink shoes placed with meticulous neatness on the floor. With purposeful steps, he approaches the desk where a silver teapot and a China cup and saucer rest on delicate lace doilies, suggesting a feigned sense of elegance. He methodically opens and searches through the drawers, rifling through their contents until he discovers files adorned with photographs, each marked with a red cross, notably one of Mad-Eye Moody and another of Professor Dumbledore, each photo exuding a sense of foreboding. As the Supervisor turns, Harry emerges from Umbridge's office, his demeanor grim and resolute, his clothes soaked, indicating a prior unseen struggle, before turning away and making his exit. He and Ron step out of the lift on the courtroom level, their attention briefly caught by a man being forcefully escorted away by two guards. Harry, with urgency, tugs on Ron's lapel, signaling him to follow as they proceed towards the courtroom entrance. From a high bench within the courtroom, Umbridge presides over the proceedings, her voice authoritative and grating, while wearing a locket around her neck that captures Harry's focus. Mary, seated below, catches Ron's eye, prompting Harry to push Ron forward into the courtroom while he tactically hangs back. Yaxley, ever watchful, observes the proceedings. As Ron positions himself beside Mary, a silent understanding passes as Harry nods, prompting Mary to hold up the locket. Overhead, Dementors hover ominously, their presence casting a chilling effect. Harry's gaze remains locked on Umbridge, the locket around her neck drawing his concentration as his wand slides purposefully into his hand. The confrontation heightens as Umbridge becomes aware, her eyes widening, while Hermione quivers with anticipation. Ron's face contorts in concentration as he manages to zap Yaxley with a spell. In a moment of decisive action, Hermione seizes the locket from around Umbridge's neck and swiftly tosses it to Harry, a transformation complete as he regains his composure. Yaxley, witnessing their bold move, watches as they make a hasty retreat. The group, pursued by the hovering Dementors, rushes into the lift, their escape almost thwarted by the Dementors' skeletal arms and elongated fingers reaching through the metal grill, attempting to drain the very essence from the four confined within. Harry, with quick reflexes, raises his wand, the tip glowing with energy as he performs a spell that forces the Dementors to recoil, allowing the lift to shoot upwards. As the lift halts, the atrium buzzes with activity, people bustling on walkways and at ground level. The group, cautious but resolved, exits the lift into the busy atrium. Hermione and Harry, now restored to their true selves, survey their surroundings, while Ron still appears as Reginald, creating an odd juxtaposition as Mary clings to him, her hands tenderly taking his face before she plants a kiss on his lips. During this moment of affection, Ron visibly shrinks, his features shifting back to his own, causing Mary to step back in surprise as the real Reginald appears nearby, clad only in his vest and boxers, bewildered by the sight of Ron. Ron, feeling the weight of the situation, turns just as uniformed guards, alerted to their presence, begin their pursuit of Harry. Yaxley arrives in the lift, his expression set with determination as Hermione and Ron sprint after Harry, weaving through the chaos. Yaxley, relentless, pushes past bystanders, casting energy bursts at the fleeing trio, the magical attacks barely missing them. In a swift and cunning move, Harry spins his wand, directing its power towards a stack of posters. Instantly, the reward posters for Harry, labeled Undesirable Number One, whirl into the air, causing a momentary distraction as Yaxley finds himself nearly enveloped, batting them away in frustration. The trio reaches the corridor, urgency propelling them forward as Yaxley launches another spell, only for it to backfire, resulting in his own disarmament. Ron, feeling the urgency, grimaces as he runs, risking a glance over his shoulder to see Yaxley closing in, the chase far from over.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Harry stealthily enters Umbridge's office, noting the decor of cat-adorned China plates and the pink upholstered chair with neatly placed shoes. He inspects the desk, discovering files with crossed-out photos of Mad-Eye Moody and Professor Dumbledore. As the Supervisor turns, Harry exits the office, visibly upset and drenched. Rejoining Ron, they leave the lift at courtroom level. They witness a man being escorted away by guards before Harry guides Ron toward the courtroom. There, Umbridge addresses a woman from a high bench, wearing a locket. Harry nudges Ron forward to join Mary, as Dementors hover ominously. Locking eyes on Umbridge's locket, Harry readies his wand. As the situation escalates, Ron zaps Yaxley, allowing Hermione to snatch the locket from Umbridge. They flee as Dementors pursue them into a lift, only to be thwarted by the closing gate. Harry repels the Dementors with a spell, and the lift ascends swiftly.

Emerging into a bustling atrium, the group surveys their surroundings before stepping out. Hermione and Harry have returned to their normal appearances, while Ron, still resembling Reginald, receives a transformative kiss from Mary that returns him to his own form. The real Reginald, now in his undergarments, appears startled. Guards pursue Harry just as Yaxley reaches the atrium, prompting Hermione and Ron to follow Harry in their escape. Yaxley aggressively pushes through the crowd, casting spells that narrowly miss the trio. In response, Harry conjures a whirlwind of posters to temporarily overwhelm Yaxley. The trio dashes down a corridor, Ron glancing back as Yaxley gains ground, only to be disarmed by a cleverly timed spell.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry slips inside Umbridge's office, where the walls, decorated with China plates showing pictures of cats and famously despised by many of her students, create an unsettling atmosphere, and raises his wand. Umbridge's chair is upholstered in pink, a color she notoriously favors, and Harry notices two passive pink shoes placed neatly on the floor, indicating her meticulous nature. He crosses to the desk, where there's a silver teapot, an heirloom belonging to her grandmother, and a China cup and saucer on lace doilies, and searches drawers. He finds files with photos attached, one of Mad-Eye Moody, a respected Auror known for his paranoia and magical eye, with a red cross through the photo and another of Professor Dumbledore, the beloved headmaster of Hogwarts, crossed through in red. The Supervisor turns, and Harry emerges from Umbridge's office grim-faced, turns, and walks away, sopping wet from a prior encounter with a magical trap. Harry and Ron leave the lift at courtroom level, where a man, accused of being a Muggle-born in a climate of extreme prejudice, is hauled away by two guards. Harry tugs Ron's lapel, and they walk towards the courtroom where, from a high bench, Umbridge addresses a woman sitting below while wearing the locket known as Slytherin's Locket, a powerful heirloom around her neck. Mary sees Ron, and Harry pushes Ron forward into the courtroom, staying back himself, while Yaxley, a Death Eater with a reputation for ruthlessness, sits watching the proceedings. Ron stands beside Mary, Harry nods, and she holds it up as Dementors, the dark creatures infamous for their soul-sucking abilities, hover above. Harry's eyes are fixed on Umbridge as he spots the locket around her neck, and his wand drops into his hand, ready for action. Umbridge sees it, Hermione trembles in fear but stands firm, and his face distorts as Ron zaps Yaxley with a spell taught in defense classes at Hogwarts. Hermione grabs the locket from Umbridge and tosses it to Harry, now back to himself, as Yaxley sees them race off. The hovering Dementors chase the group into the lift, but they're stopped by the closing gate as their chilling arms and long-boned fingers reach through the metal grill, attempting to suck the souls out of the four in the lift. Harry raises his wand, casting the Patronus Charm, a spell known to repel Dementors, forcing them back with a spell, and the lift zooms upwards. The atrium is busy, with people upon walkways and at ground level, as a lift arrives and the group looks around before stepping out into it, a hubbub of the Ministry of Magic. Hermione and Harry are both back to themselves, thanks to a Polyjuice Potion reversal, but Ron still looks like Reginald, and Mary clings to him, taking his face in her hands and kissing him on the lips. During the kiss, Ron shrinks and transforms back to himself, and Mary steps back as the real Reginald appears in his vest and boxers, seeing Ron, who turns. Uniformed guards chase Harry as Yaxley arrives in the lift, and Hermione and Ron race after Harry. Yaxley, a high-ranking official bent on their capture, barges past people, hurling bursts of energy at the trio, narrowly missing them as Harry spins his wand at a pile of posters, causing the reward posters for Harry Undesirable Number One, a cruel smear campaign by the Ministry, to swirl around the atrium, almost engulfing Yaxley, who brushes them aside. The trio reaches the corridor as Yaxley aims another burst, but the spell disarms Yaxley. Ron grimaces as he runs, glances back, and sees Yaxley gaining on him, spurred by the adrenaline of their daring escape.

Yaxley barges past people hurling bursts of energy at the trio narrowly missing them as Harry spins his wand at a pile of posters causing the reward posters for Harry. Undesirable Number One to swirl around the atrium almost engulfing. Yaxley who brushes them aside. The trio reaches the corridor as Yaxley aims another burst but the spell disarms Yaxley. Ron grimaces as he runs glances back and sees Yaxley gaining on him.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Harry slips inside Umbridge's office where the walls are hung with China plates showing pictures of cats and raises his wand. Umbridge's chair is upholstered in pink and Harry notices two passive pink shoes placed neatly on the floor. He crosses to the desk where there is a silver teapot and a China cup and saucer on lace doilies and searches drawers. He finds files with photos attached one of MadEye Moody with a red cross through the photo and another of Professor Dumbledore crossed through in red. The Supervisor turns and Harry emerges from Umbridge's office grimfaced turns and walks away sopping wet. Harry and Ron leave the lift at courtroom level where a man is hauled away by two guards. Harry tugs Ron's lapel and they walk towards the courtroom where from a high bench Umbridge addresses a woman sitting below while wearing the locket around her neck. Mary sees Ron and Harry pushes Ron forward into the courtroom staying back himself while Yaxley sits watching the proceedings. Ron stands beside Mary. Harry nods and she holds it up as Dementors hover above. Harry's eyes are fixed on Umbridge as he spots the locket around her neck and his wand drops into his hand. Umbridge sees it. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Hermione trembles and his face distorts as Ron zaps Yaxley. Hermione grabs the locket from Umbridge and tosses it to Harry now back to himself as Yaxley sees them race off. The hovering Dementors chase the group into the lift but they are stopped by the closing gate as their arms and longboned fingers reach through the metal grill attempting to suck the souls out of the four in the lift. Harry raises his wand forcing the Dementors back with a spell and the lift zooms upwards. The atrium is busy with people upon walkways and at ground level as a lift arrives and the group looks around before stepping out into it. Hermione and Harry are both back to themselves but Ron still looks like Reginald and Mary clings to him taking his face in her hands and kissing him on the lips. During the kiss Ron shrinks and transforms back to himself and Mary steps back as the real Reginald appears in his vest and boxers seeing Ron who turns. Uniformed guards chase Harry as Yaxley arrives in the lift and Hermione and Ron race after Harry. Yaxley barges past people hurling bursts of energy at the trio narrowly missing them as Harry spins his wand at a pile of posters causing the reward posters for Harry. Undesirable Number One to swirl around the atrium almost engulfing. Yaxley who brushes them aside. The trio reaches the corridor as Yaxley aims another burst but the spell disarms Yaxley. Ron grimaces as he runs glances back and sees Yaxley gaining on him.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Benny sneaks into Blanchard's greenhouse, where the fences are decorated with Italian vases displaying images of turtles, and lifts his broomstick. Blanchard's stool is draped in orange, and Benny notices two active orange boots placed awkwardly on the ceiling. He hops to the cabinet, where there's a bronze kettle and an Italian mug and plate on paper mats, and inspects compartments. He discovers parchments with sketches attached, one of Clever Fox with a blue star over the sketch and another of Chef Sparrow marked with blue. The Inspector pivots, and Benny exits Blanchard's greenhouse beaming, pivots, and hops away, completely dry. Benny and Tim exit the elevator at gallery level, where a lady is pushed forward by two ushers. Benny nudges Tim's collar, and they hop towards the gallery where, from a low podium, Blanchard speaks to a man standing above while wearing the bracelet around his wrist. Lila spots Tim, and Benny nudges Tim forward into the gallery, staying back himself, while Vexley stands observing the happenings. Tim stands beside Lila, Benny winks, and she raises it up as Specters hover below. Benny's nose is locked onto Blanchard as he notices the bracelet around his wrist, and his broomstick jumps into his grip. Blanchard spots it, Cordelia shivers, and his grin contorts as Tim sparks Vexley. Cordelia seizes the bracelet from Blanchard and lobs it to Benny, now grinning, as Vexley observes them scurry off. The hovering Specters pursue the crew into the elevator, but they're blocked by the shutting doors as their arms and short-clawed toes reach through the wooden lattice, attempting to suck the courage out of the four in the elevator. Benny lifts his broomstick, pushing the Specters away with a charm, and the elevator soars downwards. The auditorium is quiet, with creatures along bridges and underground level, as an elevator arrives and the crew searches around before leaping out into it. Cordelia and Benny are both grinning, but Tim still appears like Gregory, and Lila clutches him, gripping his arm in her claws and pecking him on the cheek. During the peck, Tim inflates and changes back to himself, and Lila hops forward as the real Gregory pops up in his coat and capris, spotting Tim, who beams. Decorated ushers pursue Benny as Vexley arrives in the elevator, and Cordelia and Tim scurry after Benny. Vexley shoves through creatures, flinging bolts of water at the group, barely nicking them as Benny twirls his broomstick at a stack of crates, causing the bounty crates for Benny Outlaw Number Nine to twirl around the auditorium, nearly enveloping Vexley, who shoves them away. The group enters the hallway as Vexley fires another bolt, but the charm depowers Vexley. Tim frowns as he hops, peeks forward, and spots Vexley retreating from him.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry sneaks into Umbridge's office, searching through drawers and finding files with crossed-out photos, including those of Mad-Eye Moody and Dumbledore. After emerging grim-faced and soaked, he and Ron head to the courtroom where Umbridge, wearing a locket, addresses a woman. Harry pushes Ron forward, and they spot the locket. As Dementors hover above, Ron zaps Yaxley, allowing Hermione to grab the locket from Umbridge and toss it to Harry. The group flees into a lift, pursued by Dementors. Harry casts a spell to repel them, and the lift ascends. In the atrium, Ron, still appearing as Reginald, is kissed by Mary, causing him to revert to his true self. Real Reginald appears, prompting a chase as Yaxley arrives. Harry spins his wand, causing reward posters to swirl and nearly engulf Yaxley. The trio escapes down a corridor, with Yaxley pursuing and narrowly missing them with his attacks until disarmed.
